Package com.example.eventlottery

Class InfoActivityTest

java.lang.Object
com.example.eventlottery.InfoActivityTest
public class InfoActivityTest extends Object
Unit tests for InfoActivity Tests business logic for date formatting and status management

    Method
    Description
    void
    setUp()
    Sets up test fixtures before each test method Creates a test user and event with specific dates for testing
    void
    testEventDescription()
    Tests that event description is properly stored and retrieved Verifies the description field matches expected value
    void
    testEventHasValidData()
    Tests that Event object contains all required non-null fields Verifies event data integrity after creation
    void
    testEventOrganizer()
    Tests that event organizer information is correctly stored Verifies the organizer name matches expected value
    void
    testEventTimeOrdering()
    Tests that event times are correctly ordered (end time after start time) Ensures logical consistency of event duration
    void
    testFormatEventDateTime_EveningTime()
    Tests that formatEventDateTime correctly handles evening times (PM) Verifies the format includes both the time and 'at' separator
    void
    testFormatEventDateTime_MidnightTime()
    Tests that formatEventDateTime handles midnight (12:00 AM) correctly Ensures edge case time values are formatted properly
    void
    testFormatEventDateTime_MorningTime()
    Tests that formatEventDateTime correctly handles morning times (AM) Verifies the formatted string contains day of week and proper time format
    void
    testFormatEventDateTime_NoonTime()
    Tests that formatEventDateTime handles noon (12:00 PM) correctly Verifies all key components (month, separator, time) are present
    void
    testFormatEventDateTime_WithValidDate()
    Tests that formatEventDateTime produces a valid formatted string for a specific date Verifies the format includes the 'at' separator and time with colons
    void
    testMultipleRegisteredEvents()
    Tests that user's registeredEvents map can store multiple events Verifies the map correctly maintains multiple event statuses
    void
    testSetRegisteredEvents()
    Tests that setRegisteredEvents correctly replaces the entire map Verifies the method used when loading data from Firestore in InfoActivity
    void
    testSetWaitlistedEventIds_EmptyList()
    Tests that setWaitlistedEventIds correctly updates the waitlist Verifies the method handles empty lists properly
    void
    testUserDataConsistency()
    Tests that user data remains consistent when status is changed Verifies the user object maintains data integrity through operations
    void
    testUserEventStatus_Accepted()
    Tests that user can have "Accepted" status stored in registered events Verifies the registeredEvents map correctly stores and retrieves Accepted status
    void
    testUserEventStatus_Declined()
    Tests that user can have "Declined" status stored in registered events Verifies the registeredEvents map correctly stores and retrieves Declined status
    void
    testUserEventStatus_Notified()
    Tests that the user correctly retrieves "Notified" status for an event Verifies getStatusForEvent returns the correct status string
    void
    testUserEventStatus_NotRegistered()
    Tests that getStatusForEvent handles non-existent events gracefully Ensures the method returns a valid status string even for unregistered events
    void
    testUserInitialState()
    Tests that user has proper initial state with initialized collections Verifies registeredEvents and waitlistedEvents are not null after creation
